text: Durius or Durio was a god worshiped by the ancient Lusitanians and Celtiberians of the Iberian peninsula. He was a personification of what is today known as the river Douro and is usually depicted holding a fishing net. A shrine dedicated to him was known to exist in the vicinity of Porto in Roman times.Forty, Jo. Mythology: A Visual Encyclopedia, Sterling Publishing Co., 2001, p. 272. ==References== Category:Lusitanian gods Category:Sea and river gods
title: Durius
